column5: Really great photos. Is that the same water snake that's been living in that rock crevice at that dock for about 5 years now?
Photos are mint....
Wow Joey...  There's definetly more to Lakair then fishing..  Well done!!
Yes it is, and babies too
You take great pictures ... thanks for sharing your trip report

LOL!  See the fascination with the snakes now!  Just awesome shots Joey, and some great fishing too.  You're on fire this year!!!  And, I think you've convinced me to take the Nikon and telescopic lens off my dad's hands and get down to taking some better photos.
Always amazing pics Joey.. You have a real talent for wildlife.
What else can I say,the loon pics couldn't get any better.Your pictures are awesome!!!!!!!!!!!Great fishing week.What a holiday!!
Thanks again all.  Drew, I've got enough competition with you already, now you're gonna bring out the good camera  Looking forward to seeing some "good" photos from you
Beautiful photos!
Excellent photos! Great to see the Bald Eagles showing up so much, they are coming back strong. The bird photos are really well done. Nice muskies!
Great pictures Joey, thanks for sharing. The camera you're using, must be something else
Could be the "user" of the camera   Thanks everyone.  Looking forward to doing it all again in July
Exceptional photos! You should be very proud of them! Thanks for the narrative as well as the pics.

A well known photographer was invited to a dinner party. The host complimented her on her photos and said " I really like your photos, you must have a great camera. The photographer did not reply. But smiled. When leaving, the photographer commented to his host, " great meal! You must have an exceptional stove"! No comment was heard from the host.
Great Photos and nice report!
Wow, thanks so much guys.  Awww, c'mon, I want to hear about the mink story, please!!!!!!!
Then we will see you there  Might even show ya a spot or two
sweet.should be fun

I'll be up there as well from the 20th to the 27th. Which cabin will you be in ?    I'm in the prospector's tent that week. Unfortunately, I'll be doing this trip solo as Patsy doesn't get as much vacation time.  (Just not gonna be the same this time     ) With all the muskies I'm gonna get - that should be interesting  (guess no pics this time - ya'all will just have to trust me)  We gotta say hi and share a couple stories (or lies - whichever it happens to be).
Oh Oh Oh ...    SHOW ME   !!!!!!!!!!!!!
Great report and pictures!!  LOL "BIRD!!"  also love the cross armed pike hold...  Moniques favorite!!
Well honestly, how else are you supposed to hold a pike  Thanks!
Awesome photos and report Joey.

Awesome report and some amazing captures.  Your musky is a very clean looking fish and the osprey shot looking head on with its yap open made me chuckle.  You seem to always be at at the right place at the right time, keep those pictures rolling in
Joey, those loon pics are about as perfect as they get!
Well done Joey very nice photos and a report to be proud of.  Art
Thanks again guys, really had alot of fun taking the pics.
Excellent pictures as always Joey...thanks for sharing them..I agree with Rich, some of those could easily be published...you have an eye for it that's for sure....  Keep 'em coming...  Maureen
Fantastic pics Joey... as ever...  Thank you so much for your art work... we love it...!!  Was good to see you and Paul.....  (maybe I will be more chatty next time....?)  best....   the cap't....
gonna have to check my email for the cabin number. all stories will have to be lies.tomorrow will be my first day out fishing this yr and its only for a few hours. ill make them good lies tho
Thanks Mo, and  you are more than welcome Kevin.  Hope you and Les enjoy it for years to come.
Amazing pics!
awesome trip and pictures congrats
amazing photos... how come mine never look that good.
Some great pictures there Joey, looks like a great week in paradise.
Great report as always Joey!!! Nice ski and great pics.
Beauty report Joey! What can I say about your photography......just awesome. Looking forward to seeing you guys in July.

Thank you all so much, got a good shot of the supermoon last night too that's in the photog section.  What camera do you have Freshtrax?  Yes Roy, I'm counting the days.  Tell J to bring the fixins for that smoked salmon/avacado thingy she makes.  I'll even buy the salmon and avacado if you want!!!!!

Paul and I just spent a week at Lakair, joined by Rich and Patsy.  We had a wonderful time and although the weather was not the greatest, it was better than being too hot in the boat all day.  We had rain, winds and even a tornado warning on Sunday.  We survived though and just got a good, long thunderstorm instead.  Although the dark, low swirling clouds were a bit ominous.  We arrived Saturday to nice weather but a bit cool for June.  Sunday was rainy and a bit muggy so we just puttered around and fished for pickerel in the morning, of which we caught none.  We could not fish the afternoon due to the tornado warning and thunderstorms.  Monday was windy and cool, but good with Paul catching 9 pike and I caught 12 pike and a nice 36" musky.  Nice way to start the week    We had a nice fish fry with Rich and Patsy that night, that was delicious.   Tuesday was pike day again, with Paul catching 2 and me catching 5.  Wednesday more pike, Paul 4, me 6  Thursday was the windiest day of any of them all.  I got 5 pike, 1 pickerel, 1 perch and had a musky on, but lost it boatside, then had another musky follow.  Paul got a 38" musky, 7 pike, 1 pickerel, 1 perch and a teeny, tiny LMB.  His musky was very beat up and had many cuts and gashes all over.  One big round hole on the other side that does not show.                Friday was our last day and we hit the water hard for a larger musky, but were denied.  We ended up with Paul getting 5 pike and a nice 19" OOS Smallie (By one day) and I got 4 pike.  Paul also saw a bear, which was booking it up a rock and I missed it he was running so fast.  Rich and Patsy left before us this morning and we headed out about noon.  We tried to wait for Lew and Diane but they had not arrived by the time we were ready to go  Saw some awesome wildlife and took some pics for you all to enjoy.  So here they are in no particular order.   LOONS               HERONS              SNAKES                     MINK                     Part 2 to follow......

PART 2   Merganser Duck               GULLS         OSPREY                 Hey, when ya gotta go, ya gotta go!!!     TURKEY VULTURE     HAWK     EAGLE  Not sure why he is carrying all the grass while soaring for food.  Stuck on him maybe?            EASTERN PHOEBE           NORTHERN FLICKER         COMMON YELLOWTHROAT      CEDAR WAXWING trying his darndest to get a string out of a tree, unsuccessfully               Ruby Throated Sapsucker     Not sure what this one is, but he was cute        Large Dragonfly         BEE           A Twofer     Ralphie LOVED Rich     Rich N Patsy        Digger    Boy fishing at dusk           Hope you enjoyed the pics.  Had a great time with you Rich and Patsy.  See you in July Rich.  Thanks to Leslie and Kevin for making our stay awesome.  Thanks for the upgrade Les and Congrats to Kevin!!!   Cheers,  Joey
Very nice report, great looking musky!
Even if the Muskie fishing wasn't all that great, looks like you guys still had an awesome week up there. Your photos are simply amazing.  cheers, Ron...
wow, looks like a great time. Fantastic photos - that one of the Cedar Waxwing givin' her - awesome.
looks like a great time  and great photos toop

Yep - we also had a great time with you guys up there.    Not sure I'll get anything put up yet today or not. Love that first Osprey shot wide eyed and mouth open - just like he is ready to give you a piece of his mind. I see you did post the one pic of the Osprey doing his business. See ya both soon.
Wow Joey. Nice report, but the pics are amazing! When you put your mind to taking up a new hobby, you don't fool around.
Totally awesome report Joey great photo tour thanks

Thanks guys.  Paul and Rich were giving me a hard time, ribbing me about my bird photography, saying I was obsessed     they kept going "BIRD"!!!  But I'm happy with the results and also of finding them and then trying to figure out what some of them were!
great photos Joey ! didja get a new telephoto lens ?
I really think Canadian Geographic should publish a lot of your photos - quite a few of these are just that good.
nice muskies,  you take great pictures, I miss my boston terrier,
Great report! Awesome pics!
FreaKin Brilliant!!
Those really are awesome photos Joey!  I'd love to take you on a duck hunt to photograph the whole thing. You certainly havve an eye for the birds! Great stuff!   S.
Excellent report Joey and spectacular pics as usual!   That's a great Muskie!!

Woodenboater, the lens is not new, but the camera is and I've been taking my photography a bit more seriously lately.  Thanks  Thanks Rich  Chris, he's a French Bulldog, but they do look very similar.  I almost got a Boston actually, it was a toss up.  Sinker, that would be fun !!!  Thanks everyone, much appreciated.
awesome.the wife and i are going to be at lakair for a few days at the end of july. im pumped. my inbox accepts tips on pike and muskie locations lol
Great report and even better pics! Did you get the muskie on one of your new lures?
Great report thanks.

What dates?  We'll be back up again in July aswell!!    No, I was very disappointed in the components.  I bought them from a Canadian lure making company, and they had "new" S shaped stirrup clevises so you didn't have to use two, only one component, and they broke right off and tossed the blades with them.  I will be having a word with them and requesting some kind of refund for all the work and wasted components.  So, anyone buying any musky lure components, do NOT get the S shaped stirrup clevises that are now available.
I must say, I read ALL reports, etc..... These are some of the MOST incredible pictures I have seen... Great job! Love it!!
Incredible shots Capn'!
Thanks for the report and I really enjoyed the wildlife pics. Minks are so cute till you get one in your fishing net and they go ballistic and spray everywhere... Don't ask.
